Comments_List: I learned a lot about how the process of writing works. I have not had the chance to completely finish and revise a long piece from beginning to end, and to get the chance to do so provided invaluable experience. Under Professor Choi's guidance, I feel confident enough to will keep expanding my project in the coming year so that it is eventually ready for publication.
Received highly personal feedback on how to write, on this particular project, and on the writers life
My advisor was great and I learned a ton about how to structure, edit, and get through a long piece of writing.
I guess it depends on the advisor. Mine was incredibly good, so it was basically all strengths.

If you have a chance to do an independent study with Professor Cunningham, absolutely do! He was so thoughtful with his feedback and generous with his time. He also made the pace of working on the thesis very manageable.
An amazing experience---it's a privilege to be able to work on a substantial project like this under the guidance of brilliant and accomplished writers.
I would, but make sure you start the project early so you have plenty of time to edit. And make sure you pick an advisor who will push you.
